head.title: Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. - Page #14

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #14 of 32 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Umfreville, Edward. Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0030

div.p: & pass'd ye Canoe down ye Rapid. (Here the place has all the appearance of a Creek with a Strong Currt in our favour[.]) From the bottom of the Rapid ¼ to another Rapid abt 70 yds long, men debark'd & led ye Canoe down it, from the bottom it opens into a lac, in which went ½m. to a pt on Rt a small rocky I. on Lt – then NWbN1½ to a pt 2 bays & 1 Isle on Rt & 2 bays & 3 Isles on Lt[.] Then Travers'd 1m. to the pt of an I. same Co deep bay & sevl Is on Rt[.] Then N1m. to ye pt of an Id many Is on Lt – NW¾ to a pt a bay & sevl Is on Rt[.] Then travers'd over to a rocky face of the banks NW1m. an Id laying on the Rt – went rod ye rock to a narrow Rapid on Lt leaving the lac behind us, which I nam'd lac des Isles, the Canoe went very well down this Rapid, then 5m. in a narrow Chanl after which it opens into a lac, went 1¼m. to a pt on Rt 1 bay & 1 Isle on Lt[.] (Encamp'd[.])

July 7 Monday Wednesday. From the pt last night WbS¾ a bay & rocky Is on Rt the same of Lt – then in a Chanl like a broad Riv. Wt 1½ on ye Lt is small I. at the end of the Co – WSW a traverse to a pt on Lt a bay on Rt ½m. – rod ye pt to the end of a bay abt ¼m. to a rapid in a narrow Channel, men debark'd (except 2) & shot it – a short dist. from the former is another Shoot, pass'd it as before[,] then it opens into a lac, pass'd it as before turn'd ye 1st pt on Lt & then went WSW½m. to the entrance of a Channel like the mo of a River then SSW1m. to a rock on the pt of an I. on Rt pass'd a rocky pt on Lt also a deep bay on Lt from the pt SW1m. to the bottom of a Rapid, pass'd 3 I on Rt & 2 on ( Lt (here the Currt runs Etly being agt us) – this is a Port. 263yds long over a good road & call'd Port. à la line, at the bottom of the Rapid are Poison dorè, Jack, Carp & white fish, from the top of the Rapid in a spacious River which our Guide calls Riviere de la Port. à la line – after going up it a SWly Co 4½ m. turn'd rod a rocky pt on Lt & went SE to a pt on Rt ¾ m, having a deep bay on Lt then SWbS¼ to a pt turn'd rod it & then went 1m. SW. to a narrow Chanl near wch lies a round rocky I. havg entd ye Channel went among Stones above water agt a S.C. near ¼m. to a short rapid, ye men debark'd & led ye Canoe agt it, SWbS2½ (sevl large Stones in the River) to a narrow neck between rocks, from this entd a lac call'd lac de bute de Sable, & went SWbS2½ to a pt on Rt along the Wt shore, having 2 Is & sevl high Stones on Lt – then to a pt on Rt SWbW2m. 4 Iss & stones on Lt – from this pt left ye Wt shore, & travers'd SSW4m. 4 I. & a deep bay on Rt & a deep bay with Is at a distance on our Lt – this brought us to a narrow stony Chanl & rapid[,] men debark'd & led the Canoe up it – then SbW½ to another stony Channel S.C. pass'd a narrow opening on Lt which leads into ye lac we just came out of – then SW. to a pt on Rt ¾ a deep bay on each side, & opposite to each other – thence WbN to a stony Channel 1m. a deep bay on Lt – pass'd ye Channel & went 3½ to a sandy pt on Rt 1 small bay & anothr very deep & wide on Rt also 1 deep bay & Is on Lt – went rod ye pt ½ m. to a pt of Stones on Rt then cross'd the mouth of a bay ¼ m. over to Port. des Attucon, at present 800yds long & middling road, but a passage might be made much shorter – there is a Strait very stony between ye 2 lacs, thro' wch we pass'd ye Canoe – then entd a lac wch is call'd lac du Port. de Pishu – went in it SWbW1m. from the Port. to the pt of a small Id on ye Lt – pass'd 2 on the Rt – WNW2m. to Port. de Pishu 64yds over a good road a bay & 2 small Is on Rt & a bay & 1 Id on Lt. from the Port. a small lac, which we cross'd WNW1½ m. to Port. des Cyprès 616yds over a good road.

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
